body:
As of the moment OPAL is a work in progress and is non-functional for the purpose of research. We would like to invite people in the community to contribute, whether it be simply using the software, filing bugs, or working on the code base.

### Community
We are working on putting together community resources. There is currently a [Wiki](https://github.com/Otago-PsyAn-Lab/Otago-PsyAn-Lab/wiki) available and a [Community](https://plus.google.com/communities/100952697983976511204) on Google+.

If you have any issues, whether they be bugs or feature requests, please file theme on the [Project Tracker](https://github.com/Otago-PsyAn-Lab/Otago-PsyAn-Lab/issues).

### History
OPAL was intially developed as the Otago Touch and Gesture Observer under a 
University of Otago Research Grant (UORG) to Hunter Hatfield (@HunterHatfield). As 
the Otago PsyAn Lab this research platform is made available to the public, in 
particular the Linguistics and Psychology research community, under the terms 
of the General Public License v3 and the requirement that all copyright and 
attribution notices be preserved.
